sense.name: leaving
sense.commentary: WITHDRAWAL[+event] secession - the act of separating
sense.examples: The south's withdrawal caused quite a ruckus. The minutes noted that George's withdrawal from the club was at six o'clock.

sense.name: backdown
sense.commentary: climb-down - a retraction of a previously held position
sense.examples: The withdrawal of his accusation was against his better judgement.

sense.name: emotional leaving
sense.examples: His withdrawal from the group of friends began after his father's death.

sense.name: drugs
sense.commentary: drug withdrawal - the termination of drug taking
sense.examples: Her cocaine withdrawal was especially difficult.

sense.name: act of removing money
sense.commentary: WITHDRAWAL[+event] the act of taking out money or other capital
sense.examples: The large withdrawal was at three o'clock on Tuesday. He couldn't make his withdrawal because the machine was out of money.

sense.name: the money itself
sense.commentary: the money taken out when a withdrawal is made
sense.examples: He put his withdrawal in his pocket immediately. I spent that whole withdrawal on candy.
